info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 12 at 2:58PM MDT until May 13 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
...EXTENDED DURATION OF CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS AREAWIDE MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...
.An approaching Pacific low pressure system moving into the Great Basin will induce strong winds across the Desert Southwest Tuesday and Wednesday. The region will continue quite dry with minimum RH in the single digits and very poor overnight recovery. Warmer than average temperatures will also persist, leading to deep mixing and instability. West to southwest winds will increase to 25 to 35 mph with gust 40 to 50 mph common in the afternoon both days. Area mountains will see slightly stronger winds, and higher gusts. Fire weather conditions will become Critical to Extreme each day across all of Southern New Mexico and far west Texas.
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR ALL OF SOUTHERN NEW MEXICO AND FAR WEST TEXAS...
The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has issued a Red Flag Warning for critical to extreme fire weather conditions, which is in effect from 11 AM to 9 PM MDT Tuesday. A Red Flag Warning has also been issued from 11 AM to 9 PM MDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 055 Texas Fire Weather Zone 055 El Paso County, Fire Weather Zone 056 Texas Fire Weather Zone 056 Hudspeth County, Fire Weather Zone 110 Southwest Mountains/Gila NF/Apache NF/GLZ, Fire Weather Zone 112 South Central Lowlands and Southern Rio Grande Valley/BLM/GLZ and Fire Weather Zone 113 Capitan and Sacramento Mountains/Lincoln NF/LNZ.
* TIMING...Both Tuesday and Wednesday between 11 am and 9 pm.
* WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph lowlands, 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph mountains.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 19 percent lowlands, 10 to 15 percent mountains.
* TEMPERATURES...Up to 91.
* EXPERIMENTAL RFTI...6 to 7 or Critical to Extreme.
* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT TUESDAY FOR CRITICAL TO EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR ALL OF SOUTHERN NEW MEXICO AND FAR WEST TEXAS

area.areaDesc: Southwest Mountains; South Central Lowlands And Southern Rio Grande Valley; Capitan And Sacramento Mountains; El Paso; Hudspeth
